page.title: 03Boughton Park, Kettering.
page.content:
Boughton House is surrounded by beautiful parkland with mature trees in abundance,much birdlife and domestic animals notably sheep.
It is said that before 1749 the 2nd. Duke of Montagu, John Â£the Planter', wanted to line the route from Boughton to London with trees. Of course this was not allowed so he planted avenues of elms and some limes, about 75 miles of them, on his own land. Dutch Elm Disease during the 1970's killed all the elms but these have been replaced with limes to preserve the style of the landscape.
Lawns lead from the house down to an ornamental lake, well stocked with fish, which has been created in the course of the River Ise.
